issue.message: Assertions are unreliable in Dalvik and unimplemented in ART. Use `BuildConfig.DEBUG` conditional checks instead.
issue.errorLine1: assert (description.length() != 0) : "invalid description: empty string is not allowed";

issue.message: Invalid package reference in library; not included in Android: `javax.xml.bind`. Referenced from `de.timroes.axmlrpc.serializer.DateTimeSerializer`.
The locale folder "`id`" should be called "`in`" instead; see the `java.util.Locale` documentation

The WIFI_SERVICE must be looked up on the Application context or memory will leak on devices < Android N. Try changing `ButterApplication.getAppContext()` to `ButterApplication.getAppContext().getApplicationContext()`

The WIFI_SERVICE must be looked up on the Application context or memory will leak on devices < Android N. Try changing `ButterApplication.getAppContext()` to `ButterApplication.getAppContext().getApplicationContext()`

issue.errorLine1: <string name="wrong_abi">Uhoh! You\'re using the wrong version of Butter for Android. The right version is being downloaded right now, if possible. If the installer is not started within a minute then your device is not supported or your internet connection is broken, which means you should try again later. If the installer fails then you must install the right version manually.</string>

issue.errorLine1: <string name="wrong_abi">Oi! Du bruker feil versjon av Butter for Android. Den riktige versjonen lastes ned nå hvis det er mulig. Hvis installasjonsprogrammet ikke starter i løpet av et minutt er ikke enheten støttet, eller så er forbindelsen til internett brutt og det betyr at du bør prøve igjen senere. Hvis installasjonen feiler må du installere den riktige versjonen manuelt.</string>

Reading app signatures from getPackageInfo: The app signatures could be exploited if not validated properly; see issue explanation for details.
Using `getString` to get device identifiers is not recommended.
Using `getString` to get device identifiers is not recommended.
`checkClientTrusted` is empty, which could cause insecure network traffic due to trusting arbitrary TLS/SSL certificates presented by peers
`checkServerTrusted` is empty, which could cause insecure network traffic due to trusting arbitrary TLS/SSL certificates presented by peers
The `release()` call is not always reached

Provide a timeout when requesting a wakelock with `PowerManager.Wakelock.acquire(long timeout)`. This will ensure the OS will cleanup any wakelocks that last longer than you intend, and will save your user's battery.

Provide a timeout when requesting a wakelock with `PowerManager.Wakelock.acquire(long timeout)`. This will ensure the OS will cleanup any wakelocks that last longer than you intend, and will save your user's battery.
This AsyncTask class should be static or leaks might occur (butter.droid.base.ui.trailer.BaseTrailerPlayerPresenterImpl.QueryYouTubeTask)
issue.errorLine1: private class QueryYouTubeTask extends AsyncTask<String, Void, Uri> {

issue.message: Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to `FileSelectorDialogFragment` which has field `list` pointing to `ListView`); this is a memory leak (and also breaks Instant Run)
Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to `Foreground` which has field `current` pointing to `Activity`); this is a memory leak (and also breaks Instant Run)
This AsyncTask class should be static or leaks might occur (butter.droid.base.subs.SubtitleDownloader.SubtitleParseTask)
issue.errorLine1: private class SubtitleParseTask extends AsyncTask<File, TimedTextObject, TimedTextObject> {

issue.message: Very long vector path (907 characters), which is bad for performance. Considering reducing precision, removing minor details or rasterizing vector.
Very long vector path (940 characters), which is bad for performance. Considering reducing precision, removing minor details or rasterizing vector.
